children.name: isValidLon
children.comment: true if [lon] is a valid longitude in the range -180..180

children.name: isValidLat
children.comment: true if [lat] is a valid latitude in the range -90..90

children.name: LatLonBounds
contains
children.comment:
Checks wheter [obj] is within this bounds.

## Possible values for [obj]
* a [LatLon] -> checks whether the point is this bounds
* a [LatLonBounds] -> checks whether the bounds are completely in this
  bounds
   
Throws [ArgumentError] if [obj] is either null or of an
unexpected type.

children.name: intersects
children.comment:
Checks wheter [n] interesects with this bounds.

Replies true, if [b] interesects, false otherwise.
Throws [ArgumentError] if [b] is null or of an unexpected type

children.name: southWest
children.comment: the south-west corner

children.name: southEast
children.comment: the south-east corner

children.name: northEast
children.comment: the north-east corner

children.name: northWest
children.comment: the north-west corner

children.name: center
children.comment: the center point

children.name: LatLonBounds
LatLonBounds.from
children.comment:
Create a bounds objects from another value [other].

## Possible values for [other]
* a [LatLonBounds] -> creates a copy of [other]

An instance of this class represents a rectangular are in geograpic
coordinates (lat/lon).

children.name: LatLon
lat
children.comment: the latitue

children.name: lon
children.comment: the longitude

children.name: LatLon
children.comment:
Creates a point with coordinates [lat] and [lon].

Throws [ArgumentError] if either [lat] or [lon] isn't in the expected
range.

children.name: LatLon.origin
children.comment: A (lon/lat) point at position (0,0).

children.name: LatLon.from

children.comment: An instance of this class represents a pair of geographic  coordinates (lat/lon).

children.name: PlateCarree
children.comment:
Trivial equirectangular (Plate Carree) projection.

The units of the projected x/y-coordinates is *degrees*,
where
* -180 <= x <= 180
*  -90 <= y <= -90

children.name: SphericalMercator
project
children.comment:
Transforms geographic coordinates into projected coordinates.

The projected coordinates are in degrees with the following ranges:
  minx=-20037508.34, maxx = 20037508.34
  miny=-20037508.34, maxy = 20037508.34

children.name: unproject
children.comment:
Transforms projected coordinates into geographic coordinates.

Both coordinates [point].x and [point].y should be in the
range (-20037508.34,+20037508.34).

Spherical Mercator is a popular map projection.

It projects (lat, lon)-coordinates to a square whose sides
each measure ~40'000km (the earths circumference). The units of the
returned x/y-coordinates is *meters*.


              (20'000km, 20'000km
      +-------o
      |       |
      |       |
      o-------+
 (-20'000km, -20'000km

children.name: Projection
project
children.comment:
Project a point (lat/lon) from a geographic coordinates into a
point (x,y) in a projected coordinate system

children.name: unproject
children.comment:
Reverse project a point (x,y) from a projected coordinate system into
a point (lat/lon) in the geoographic coordinate system.
An abstract projection

children.name: EPSG3857
children.comment: see [EPSG:3857](http://spatialreference.org/ref/sr-org/6864/)

children.name: ProjectedCRS
children.comment: The abstract base class for a projected coordinate reference systems.

children.name: code
children.comment:
The standardized identifier for this reference system

A coordinate references system can be assigned more than
one idetifier, see also [aliases]

children.name: aliases
children.comment:
A list of code aliases for this reference system.

The empty list, if no alternative codes are known for this
coordinate reference system.
